review_text: It's one of the best hospitals in Erode. I had my 1st delivery here. Doctors were very clear and didn't beat around the bush on their diagnosis and their opinion. I had few complications during my pregnancy which was handled with uttermost care and precaution. After delivery my baby was also checked frequently.  They've an in-house dietician, physiotherapists, pediatrician, general physician round the clock.  I would like to make request on improving the administration like adding floor managers.

address: No: 78/1-10, Perundurai Road, Parimalam Mahal, behind Skoda Show Room, Erode, Tamil Nadu

review_text: We started going to this hospital bcoz it's near by our home. But it turned out to be the best choice ever made... My first pregnancy... I was always nervous and scared. But sulochana doctor and Rohini doctor always gave me hope and confidence... They suggested me to see nutritionist and physiotherapist. They gave me more confidence through their diet ideas and exercises. She even cared me to cut my nails regularly. I loved the care and attention... Al scans and tests were regularly monitored by the nurse team and they wil cal u to remind and do follow up. Never seen such dedicated and positive attitude nurses.. Wit all their support and encouragement I had my normal delivery last week.. Their delivery plan and execution were perfect. Asked my opinion and respected my choice in the delivery process. Cleaning aayas were great and didnt make me feel guilty in labour room. Rooms were spacious, cleaned regularly. NICU nurse and watchman too were nice. Lactation consultant also helped me clear many doubts.. one staff even came to ask me about my stay and care given and also to give suggestions or complaints if any.. Thank u Doctor Aravind Kumar sir for taking care of our baby.. Hope I mentioned everyone... Thank u so much everyone... Suggestions: please improve canteen food quality. Sometimes it's good and sometimes it's not worth it. There's always long queue in medicals. Medical staffs dint wear masks and taking too long to serve our needs. Please maintain hygiene among the medicals' staffs and process our bills faster. Thank u all ..
name: Care 24 Medical Center & Hospital
address: No: 78/1-10, Perundurai Road, Parimalam Mahal, behind Skoda Show Room, Erode, Tamil Nadu

review_text: I saw great reviews for the hospital and Dr. Rohini and chose this hospital for my delivery. I had an elective c section due to some health issues. review_text: Had my first labour experience there. It's a nice hospital with all facilities inside. Thanks to Dr.Rohini mam and Dr.Sulochana mam for their clear explanation and friendly approach. Mine was a  normal delivery. I was fine from the beginning until third month but becoame anemic at fourth month with a fever. But during my 8th month I was completely normal without any medications(except for iron and calcium) and the doctors were very caring with 24/7 service. During my delivery (at 12.30 a.m), the doctor and nurses were very  supportive. Even I was tired during labour and did nothing. But they didn't force us for c- section and helped me deliver my baby with the help of vacuum cup. The nurses were very friendly and caring till discharge. After delivery, my baby had physical jaundice and was kept in NIC under blue light for 39 hours. Special thanks to Dr.Aravind for his help and suggestions. The nurses there were very caring with good temper and helped a lot with nursing. Even the watchman there was friendly. Overall I had a smooth delivery.
name: Care 24 Medical Center & Hospital
address: No: 78/1-10, Perundurai Road, Parimalam Mahal, behind Skoda Show Room, Erode, Tamil Nadu

This is my first experience with this hospital and to be frank i’m super satisfied with their service. I came here for my delivery and i must admit it that the care they take for every patient is so astonishing. The main reason we chose this hospital is because of its infrastructure and facilities. The hospital has 24/7 laboratories, medicals, scan centre n everything under one roof so we need not have to go out for the scans especially during this pandemic. It has security guards everywhere to see to it that everyone follows covid protocols so as to ensure the safety of their patients. They also have bunch of nurses to help us out the very second we were in need of any help. I was so afraid of the c-section but then the way Dr. Rohini handled the things , she gave me so much confidence and everything went so smoothly which was all because of her experience. We opted for the suit room which made us feel like we were never in a hospital. Nurses were always there with us all throughout to help us in feeding and everything. The hospital had also arranged a breast feeding session to teach me how to feed the baby which was very helpful. The physician and the dietitian constantly visited me everyday to help me out. Our baby was taken care by Dr. Aravind , who constantly checked the baby twice everyday. Senior Nurse Parvathi was the one who was there with me clearing all my doubts by hearing me out and gave me  the mental strength to battle out the first two days after my delivery. As i said, we came here for its infrastructure and facilities but now, I’ll recommend this hospital for not just for its facilities but also for the care shown by the doctors and the nurses. Kudos to all of them !

We were asked to go to NICU and get train on how to feed the baby. Though they teach me during delivery, again the NICU sister taught me scolding, "don't u know how to hold the baby while feeding, don't u knw how to sit while feeding". Though I know those things already, I didn't follow that in the home because I and my baby were more comfortable with other position while feeding. Then we were taught the things and were asked to come again after a week by the doctor. After a week when we went to checkup, the baby's weight remains the same. The baby's in take was not proper. But they are just keep on blaming on my feeding position. And again we were asked to go to NICU and meet Amudha(I think so she must be head nurse for baby's). I, my mom and my baby went. In home I will get help from my mom while feeding, lifting baby from floor. She asked me to feed the baby infront of her to check whether I know how to feed. At that time the baby was screaming and shaking her head, hands and legs vigorously. Mrs.Amudha was scolding me not to hold the baby in 2 hands. How can I able to hold the baby in a single hand while she is doing like that? At that time my mom, hold the baby to help help me feed. Then Mrs.Amudha started to scold my mom saying, "y r u holding the baby?, only she should take the baby and feed". Then she turned to me and asked, "is ur mom servant to u?, can't u do things on ur own, is feeding a very big thing? Can't you able to feed ur baby by yourself?" After scolding me like this, she turned to my mom and told her that she should not touch the baby hereafter. We were hurted alot by the behavior of Mrs.Amutha. I was 22 years old and this was my first child. How can a new mom handle this situation without using 2hands and without getting help? Then we changed the hospital and doctor. There they checked why the baby is not intaking the milk properly and found the reason that my baby had fix from birth itself.

We had admitted my grandfather at Care24 as he was feeling unwell and dizzy. It was concluded that the root cause was due to urinary infection. As any loved one of a patient would feel, we felt that it was not safe to keep a 84 year old person in a hospital especially during this pandemic situation. Hence, out of genuine concern, we had asked the pulmonologist Dr. Uma Shankar as to by when we can get my grandfather discharged. The very fact that we asked this question just twice, seemingly angered him to an extent that he asked us to get my grandfather discharged immediately. Guess he tried his hand at sarcasm which is expected from a stand up comedian or an English professor but not from a supposedly competent doctor to the attendants of the patient. Further, He went on to try his hand at astrology by guessing the reason for us asking for an early discharge potentially ranging, from us having a weekend outing plan, all the way till us not wanting to spend money on an elderly patient as it would be a sunk cost with nil returns on investment. Ofcourse, I am a banking professional. But I would wear my grandson's hat (removing my banker's hat) in this case, as that is more appropriate. We only wanted his expertise as a pulmonologist and not as a fortune teller or mind reader! Also, post discharge, it was cumbersome for us to even understand which hospital we needed to visit for an outpatient consultation with my aged grandfather stranded for post discharge care. That's for another day though. Otherwise, care from nurses and other support staff were upto the mark.
